instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 13MBP no video
threads.message:
Hi,

I got a 2009 13" MBP here. Board is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A.
Machine charges, turns on (chime sound) and can be started into target disk mode. However, there is no video out. Not on the internal LCD and not through the MINI DVI Port. PRAM and SMC have been reset.
GPU failure seems unlikely on this machine. Any idea where to start troubleshooting?

Cheers,

Hendrik

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 13MBP no video
threads.message: Got 3V on <CAPACITOR>C9010</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C9015</CAPACITOR>? Check if <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is high if there is 3V on <CAPACITOR>C9010</CAPACITOR> and not on <CAPACITOR>C9015</CAPACITOR>.
